Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

many humans-including myself- can hear to 60 khz if the sound is loud enough.  ultrasonic cleaners sound like the scratchy voices in the horror movies; they dont sound like a super high pitched sine wave.  thats a definite fact.

RetroCom <vfp19968@...> wrote:          Yes, I have seen this for myself. If you put a small 'tea' candle in the well of an ultrasonic cleaner light the candle and switch on, the flame reacts violently. If you record the flame with a phototransistor some voices can be heard along with noise from the ultrasonic cleaner.
